com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.checking.inline.markings.offset

Interface OffsetMarkingIndex

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ExtendedOffsetMarkingIndex
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StyledTextOffsetMarkingIndex

    public interface OffsetMarkingIndex
    The OffsetMarkingIndex is holing or calculating a mapping between key and absolute ranges in original document.
    Note:The document could change in this case the index must be updated. The best way is to add the keys directly to the text. In many text controls and applications it possible to add custom data to the text. For example in Swing you could use SimpleAttributeSet.addAttribute(Object, Object) to add the Key as a Style directly to the text of a JTextPane.

    • Field Detail

      • NULL

        static final OffsetMarkingIndex NULL
        The NULL-OffsetMarkingIndex.

    • Method Detail

      • getKeyByOffset

        Key getKeyByOffset(int offset)
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset a Key is queried for.
        Returns:
        The Key for the offset. If the offset is invalid or no Key exists return Key.NULL.

      • getRanges

        Set<Range> getRanges(Key key)
        Parameters:
        key - The Key to query Ranges for.
        Returns:
        A set of Ranges for the Key. If the Key not exists in the document at all, return an empty set.

      • isEndOffsetInclusive

        boolean isEndOffsetInclusive()
